dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 5240 IH: Fully Funding our National Security Priorities Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Titus introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To require a report on the unfunded priorities of the Department of State.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Fully Funding our National Security Priorities Act.

section.header: Report on unfunded priorities of the Department of State

subsection.text: Not later than 10 days after the date on which the budget for any fiscal year is submitted by the President to Congress pursuant to section 1105 of title 31, United States Code, the Secretary of State shall prepare and submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report on unfunded priorities of the Department of State.

paragraph.text: The report required by subsection (a) shall include, with respect to each unfunded priority covered by such report—

subparagraph.text: a summary description of such priority, including the objectives to be achieved if such priority is funded (whether in whole or in part);
the additional amount of funds recommended to be made available to achieve the objectives referred to in subparagraph (A); and
budget information with respect to such priority, including—

clause.text: the project and, if applicable, any subprojects.

paragraph.text: The report required by subsection (a) shall present the unfunded priorities covered by such report in overall order of urgency of priority among unfunded priorities.
the term appropriate committees of Congress means—

subparagraph.text: the Committee on Foreign Affairs and the Committee on Appropriations of the House of Representatives; and
the Committee on Foreign Relations and the Committee on Appropriations of the Senate; and

paragraph.text: the term unfunded priority, with respect to a fiscal year, means a program, activity, or mission requirement of an element of the Department of State that—

subparagraph.text: is not funded in the budget for such fiscal year submitted by the President to Congress pursuant to section 1105 of title 31, United States Code;

is necessary to fulfill a foreign policy or national security objective or to satisfy an information requirement associated with a goal or objective outlined in the Joint Strategic Plan agreed upon by the Department of State; and
would have been recommended for funding by the Secretary of State if—

clause.text: additional resources had been available for such budget to fund such program, activity, or mission requirement; or
the program, activity, or mission requirement has emerged since such budget was formulated.
